# See# documentation _(beta!)_

<img src="./../favicon.ico" height="50"/>

_**WARNING:** The library's soruce code is not for the faint of heart. It is ported legacy-code from an older project._<br/>
_**WARNING:** This markdown document has been autogenerated by one of the worst C# programs I've ever written ..... so use it at your own risk..._

<hr/>

### Defined effects:
The See# Library has a few (61) pre-defined bitmap effects.
The following list contains all pre-defined effects and (in most cases) a generated image rendered with the respective bitmap effect.
The test images used are the following two:

<table>
    <tbody>
        <tr>
            <th>emma.png</th>
            <th>hsv_map.png</th>
        </tr>
        <tr>
            <td><img src="./00000001.png" height="100"/></td>
            <td><img src="./00000002.png" height="100"/></td>
        </tr>
    </tbody>
</table>

Effect list:

        <tr>
            <th><code>Blend(emma, hsv_map)</code></th>

<li><a name="AddColorBlendEffect"/><b><code>AddColorBlendEffect</code></b>
   <p>This effect is identical to it's bitmap blending counterpart -- except for the fact, that it does not blend two bitmaps, but one bitmap and a color.
   <br/><a href="#AddBitmapBlendEffect">Click here</a> to jump to the corresponding bitmap blending effect.</p>
<p>The effect can be initialized using one of the following constructors (besides from the default-constructor):<ul>
<li><b><code>AddColorBlendEffect(System.Drawing.Color clr)</code></b><br/>
<i>clr:</i> 
</li>
<li><b><code>AddColorBlendEffect(System.Double r, System.Double g, System.Double b)</code></b><br/>
<i>r:</i> <br/><i>g:</i> <br/><i>b:</i> 
</li>
<li><b><code>AddColorBlendEffect(System.Double a, System.Double r, System.Double g, System.Double b)</code></b><br/>
<i>a:</i> <br/><i>r:</i> <br/><i>g:</i> <br/><i>b:</i> 
</li>
</ul></p>
</li>

<li><a name="BrightnessBitmapEffect"/><b><code>BrightnessBitmapEffect</code></b>
   <p>The effect <code>SeeSharp.Effects.BrightnessBitmapEffect</code> uses the following color matrix multiplied with each pixel information to calculate the output color at any given pixel coordinated:<br/>
<table><tbody><tr><th></th><th>R</th><th>G</th><th>B</th><th>A</th><th>O</th></tr><tr><th>R</th><td>1</td><td>0</td><td>0</td><td>0</td><td>0</td></tr><tr><th>G</th><td>0</td><td>1</td><td>0</td><td>0</td><td>0</td></tr><tr><th>B</th><td>0</td><td>0</td><td>1</td><td>0</td><td>0</td></tr><tr><th>A</th><td>0</td><td>0</td><td>0</td><td>1</td><td>0</td></tr><tr><th>F</th><td>1</td><td>1</td><td>1</td><td>1</td><td>1</td></tr></tbody></table>
   </p>
   <p>Effect applied to ...<br/>

        <tr>
            <th>0%</th>
            <th>25%</th>
            <th>50%</th>
            <th>75%</th>

   <p>The effect <code>SeeSharp.Effects.EdgeDetectionBitmapEffect</code> uses a single <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Convolution">convolution matrix</a> to calculate the resulting image:<br/>
<table><tbody><tr><td>-1</td><td>-1</td><td>-1</td></tr><tr><td>-1</td><td>8</td><td>-1</td></tr><tr><td>-1</td><td>-1</td><td>-1</td></tr></tbody></table>   </p>

<li><a name="HorizontalFlipEffect"/><b><code>HorizontalFlipEffect</code></b>
   <p>The effect <code>SeeSharp.Effects.HorizontalFlipEffect</code> uses the following transformation matrix to calculate any pixel's new coordinates:<br/>
<table><tbody><tr><td>-1</td><td>0</td></tr><tr><td>0</td><td>1</td></tr></tbody></table>
   </p>

<li><a name="HSLBitmapColorEffect"/><b><code>HSLBitmapColorEffect</code></b>
   <p>The effect <code>SeeSharp.HSLBitmapColorEffect</code> uses the following color matrix multiplied with each pixel information to calculate the output color at any given pixel coordinated:<br/>
<table><tbody><tr><th></th><th>R</th><th>G</th><th>B</th><th>A</th><th>O</th></tr><tr><th>R</th><td>1</td><td>0</td><td>0</td><td>0</td><td>0</td></tr><tr><th>G</th><td>0</td><td>1</td><td>0</td><td>0</td><td>0</td></tr><tr><th>B</th><td>0</td><td>0</td><td>1</td><td>0</td><td>0</td></tr><tr><th>A</th><td>0</td><td>0</td><td>0</td><td>1</td><td>0</td></tr><tr><th>F</th><td>1</td><td>1</td><td>1</td><td>1</td><td>0</td></tr></tbody></table>
   </p>
<p>The effect can be initialized using one of the following constructors (besides from the default-constructor):<ul>
<li><b><code>HSLBitmapColorEffect(System.Double[,] matrix)</code></b><br/>
<i>No XML documentation could be found.</i>
</li>
</ul></p>
</li>

<li><a name="KirschBitmapEffect"/><b><code>KirschBitmapEffect</code></b>
   <p>The effect <code>SeeSharp.Effects.KirschBitmapEffect</code> uses two <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Convolution">convolution matrices</a> to calculate the resulting image:<br/>

    <tbody>
        <tr>
            <th>Vertical convolution matrix</th>
            <th>Horizontal convolution matrix</th>
        </tr>
        <tr>
            <td>

            </td>
            <td>
                <table><tbody><tr><td>5</td><td>5</td><td>5</td></tr><tr><td>-3</td><td>0</td><td>-3</td></tr><tr><td>-3</td><td>-3</td><td>-3</td></tr></tbody></table>
            </td>
        </tr>
    </tbody>
</table>
</p>

<i>grayscale:</i> 
</li>

<i>amount:</i> 
</li>

</li>

        </tr>
        <tr>
<td><img src="./00000040.png" height="90"/></td><td><img src="./00000041.png" height="90"/></td><td><img src="./00000042.png" height="90"/></td><td><img src="./00000043.png" height="90"/></td><td><img src="./00000044.png" height="90"/></td></tr></tbody></table></p>
<p>The effect can be initialized using one of the following constructors (besides from the default-constructor):<ul>
<li><b><code>SepiaBitmapEffect(System.Double amount)</code></b><br/>
<i>amount:</i> 
</li>
</ul></p>
</li>
<li><a name="SharpenerBitmapEffect"/><b><code>SharpenerBitmapEffect</code></b>
   <p>The effect <code>SeeSharp.Effects.SharpenerBitmapEffect</code> uses a single <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Convolution">convolution matrix</a> to calculate the resulting image:<br/>
<table><tbody><tr><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td></tr><tr><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td></tr><tr><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td></tr><tr><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td><td>1.98</td><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td></tr><tr><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td></tr><tr><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td></tr><tr><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td><td>-0.0204</td></tr></tbody></table>   </p>
   <p><img src="./00000045.png" height="200"/></p>
<p>The effect can be initialized using one of the following constructors (besides from the default-constructor):<ul>
<li><b><code>SharpenerBitmapEffect(System.Double radius)</code></b><br/>
<i>radius:</i> 
</li>
</ul></p>

<li><a name="SobelBitmapEffect"/><b><code>SobelBitmapEffect</code></b>
   <p>The effect <code>SeeSharp.Effects.SobelBitmapEffect</code> uses two <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Convolution">convolution matrices</a> to calculate the resulting image:<br/>
<table>
    <tbody>
        <tr>
            <th>Vertical convolution matrix</th>
            <th>Horizontal convolution matrix</th>
        </tr>
        <tr>
            <td>
                <table><tbody><tr><td>1</td><td>2</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>0</td><td>0</td><td>0</td></tr><tr><td>-1</td><td>-2</td><td>-1</td></tr></tbody></table>
            </td>
            <td>
                <table><tbody><tr><td>-1</td><td>0</td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td>-2</td><td>0</td><td>2</td></tr><tr><td>-1</td><td>0</td><td>1</td></tr></tbody></table>
            </td>
        </tr>
    </tbody>
</table>
</p>
<p>The effect can be initialized using one of the following constructors (besides from the default-constructor):<ul>
<li><b><code>SobelBitmapEffect(System.Boolean grayscale)</code></b><br/>
<i>grayscale:</i> 
</li>
</ul></p>
</li>
<li><a name="SoftLightColorBlendEffect"/><b><code>SoftLightColorBlendEffect</code></b>
   <p>This effect is identical to it's bitmap blending counterpart -- except for the fact, that it does not blend two bitmaps, but one bitmap and a color.
   <br/><a href="#SoftLightBitmapBlendEffect">Click here</a> to jump to the corresponding bitmap blending effect.</p>
<p>The effect can be initialized using one of the following constructors (besides from the default-constructor):<ul>

<i>clr:</i> 
</li>
<li><b><code>SoftLightColorBlendEffect(System.Double r, System.Double g, System.Double b)</code></b><br/>
<i>r:</i> <br/><i>g:</i> <br/><i>b:</i> 
</li>
<li><b><code>SoftLightColorBlendEffect(System.Double a, System.Double r, System.Double g, System.Double b)</code></b><br/>
<i>a:</i> <br/><i>r:</i> <br/><i>g:</i> <br/><i>b:</i> 
</li>
</ul></p>
</li>
